horn (instrument; made of animal horn), bugle, hunting horn
magic flute, The Magic Flute (by Mozart)
winter wind whistling through a bamboo fence

r_ele.r: あきのしかはふえによる

sense.gloss: people may bring about their demise for love, it is easy to have one's weak points taken advantage of, in autumn (during mating season), deer come forth when they hear (a hunter's) whistle
star snapper (species of fish, Lutjanus stellatus)
spotstripe snapper (species of fish, Lutjanus ophuysenii)
Japanese transverse bamboo flute (high-pitched; usu. with seven holes)
Korean flute (horizontal bamboo flute with six holes; highest-pitched flute used in gagaku)
dragon flute, medium-pitched bark-covered bamboo transverse flute with seven holes, used in gagaku

r_ele.r: ふえふけどもおどらず

sense.gloss: we have piped unto you and ye have not danced, people ignoring one's invitation or effort to do something together
bamboo flute used in Qing music
longnose butterfly fish (Forcipiger flavissimus, species of butterflyfish from the Indo-Pacific), forcepsfish
whistling through one's fingers, whistle made by sticking one's fingers in one's mouth and blowing
mangrove jack (Lutjanus argentimaculatus), mangrove red snapper
longspine snipefish (Macroramphosus scolopax), common bellowsfish, snipe-fish, snipefish, spine trumpet fish, trumpetfish
upstage left pillar (on a noh stage), next to the flute player
flute-player seating area (noh), behind upstage left
